PageTitle: ipv6 nd anti-attack rate-limit target-ip all maximum
FuncDef:
The ipv6 nd anti-attack rate-limit target-ip all maximum command configures a rate limit for receiving ND messages based on any target IPv6 address, that is, the number of ND messages that can be processed per second based on any target IPv6 address.
The undo ipv6 nd anti-attack rate-limit target-ip all maximum command restores the default configuration. The ipv6 nd anti-attack rate-limit target-ip all maximum command configures a rate limit for receiving ND messages based on any target IPv6 address, that is, the number of ND messages that can be processed per second based on any target IPv6 address. The undo ipv6 nd anti-attack rate-limit target-ip all maximum command restores the default configuration. By default, no rate limit for receiving ND messages based on any target IPv6 address is configured. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: undo ipv6 nd { ns | na } anti-attackrate-limittarget-ipallmaximum <max-value>

ParaDef.Info:
Sets a rate limit for receiving NS messages.
-

Sets a rate limit for receiving NA messages.
-

Specifies a rate limit for receiving ND messages based on any target IPv6 address.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 5000, in messages per second.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] ipv6 nd ns anti-attack rate-limit target-ip all maximum 550
ExtraInfo: If a device is attacked, it receives a large number of ND messages within a short period. As a result, the device consumes many CPU resources to learn and respond to ND entries, affecting the processing of other services. To resolve this issue, configure a rate limit for receiving ND messages based on any target IPv6 address. After the configuration is complete, the device counts the number of ND messages received per period based on any target IPv6 address. If the number of ND messages exceeds the configured limit, the device does not process excess ND messages.
